title: LG Display's Third Quarter Loss Bigger-Than-Expected
text:
By Kwanwoo Jun

LG Display Co. Ltd. (034220.SE) posted a bigger-than-expected loss in the third quarter, as lower liquid-crystal-display panel prices continued to pummel the electronics maker.

Net loss for the September quarter was 442.20 billion Korean won ($377.0 million) compared with a net profit of KRW17.51 billion in the same quarter a year earlier, the South Korean company said Wednesday.

The third quarter loss was bigger than the KRW309.54 billion forecast by analysts on FactSet.

Revenue during the quarter fell 4.6% on year to KRW5.822 trillion, the company said.

Operating loss for the quarter stood at KRW436.74 billion--a swing from an operating profit of KRW140.07 billion a year ago.

LG Display attributed the weak earnings to steeper-than-expected declines in LCD prices due to sluggish demand. The company said it is shifting toward the more promising organic light-emitting-diode display business.
